title: Verify the  seat map displays unavailable rather than displaying as available_dimmed  when price scale contains only the ESD Restricted Buyers   in ProVenueOnline
custom_steps:
1. 1.In the venue used for event, few seats should be mapped to extended seat definition ex:E1.
2.map the buyer type to E1.
3.Create an patron & event.
the event with 2 Price Scales.
Price Scale A has some buyer types. Adult, Senior and Child available.
Price Scale B has another some  buyer types  and they assigned to ESD.Cookie Monster & Discount Available.
use only 1 seat map which contains all of the seats for Price Scales A & B.
Price Scale B has 10 Seats.
Seats 1 & 2 are assigned with one ESD Buyer type
Seats 9 & 10 are designated with the another  ESD restricted buyer type.
2. Login to the PVO application with  valid credentials.
Expected Result:
User logged in successfully.
3. Navigate to the supplier administration tab.
Expected Result:
successfully Navigated  to the supplier administration tab.
4. Create a ESD Restricted buyer type
Expected Result:
user successfully created a   ESD Restricted buyer
5. Verify the Extended Seat Restriction Public Description and extended seat restriction   fields are enabled.
Expected Result:
Extended Seat Restriction Public Description and extended seat restriction   fields are enabled.
6. enter the required details for creating new buyer and click on "apply changes"
Expected Result:
required details for creating new buyer is entered,the new buyer is successfully created.
7. user navigated to ticket sales
Expected Result:
user navigated to ticket sales successfully
8. Navigated to the  Seat map page  and perform the sale transaction
Expected Result:
sale transaction is performed with ESD restricted seats
9. Verify the  seat map displays unavailable rather than displaying as available/dimmed  when price scale contains only the ESD Restricted Buyers   in ProVenueOnline
Expected Result:
seat map displays unavailable rather than displaying as available/dimmed  when price scale contains only the ESD Restricted Buyers   in ProVenueOnline

title: Verify the Lock Seat API request by providing ESD IDs
custom_steps:
1. Prerequisite:
1) Valid Agency, User should be available
2) An Event should be available with ESD defined
3) Note down the Agency, User, Event
2. Launch the Tool for Lock Seats API
Expected Result:
Tool should be launched successfully
3. i) Select the HTTP method as POST by  clicking on the POST radio button
ii) Enter the response body parameters and  set the request content type
Expected Result:
i) Radio button should be selected for POST
ii) Response body parameters and request  content type should be set successfully
4. Set the authentication parameters:  Username and password, Auth type select as  BASIC and Check Preemptive checkbox
Expected Result:
Authentication parameters should be selected  successfully
5. Select SSl tab and set the hostname  verifier to Allow All
Expected Result:
SSL tab setting should be set successfully
6. i) Enter the Lock Seats API Request base URL
ii) Enter the request body by providing ESD id's
iii) Click Green Arrow Button
Expected Result:
An HTTP status code with 200(OK) should be displayed
7. Verify the lock seats API response
Expected Result:
ESD references for the buyer type should not be displayed in Lock Seats API Response

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. Prerequisite:
1) Valid Agency, User should be available
2) An Event should be available with ESD defined
3) Note down the Agency, User, Event
2. Launch the Tool for Lock Seats API
3. i) Select the HTTP method as POST by  clicking on the POST radio button
ii) Enter the response body parameters and  set the request content type
4. Set the authentication parameters:  Username and password, Auth type select as  BASIC and Check Preemptive checkbox
5. Select SSl tab and set the hostname  verifier to Allow All
6. i) Enter the Lock Seats API Request base URL
ii) Enter the request body by providing ESD id's
iii) Click Green Arrow Button
7. Verify the lock seats API response
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. Tool should be launched successfully
3. i) Radio button should be selected for POST
ii) Response body parameters and request  content type should be set successfully
4. Authentication parameters should be selected  successfully
5. SSL tab setting should be set successfully
6. An HTTP status code with 200(OK) should be displayed
7. ESD references for the buyer type should not be displayed in Lock Seats API Response

title: Verify the fringe case of repricing when seats are having ESD restricted buyer types
custom_steps:
1. 1. Venue should have some seats assigned with extended seat definition, note the details
2. Create a buyer type and map it to above said extended seat definition
3. Create a Price structure including the above buyer type
2. A ticket is sold using an ESD-Restricted buyer type (BUDBASH) to a seat with the required ESD.
The ESD is later removed from the seat.
Expected Result:
User should be able to complete the step successfully
3. Another user performs a re-offer on the seat and attempts to re-price the seat to another unrestricted buyer type (ADULT).  The re-price is successful.  Before checking out, the user realizes this was done in error and attempts to re-price again back to the original ESD-restricted buyer type.
Expected Result:
The validation shall find that the seat does not have the required ESD and the re-price will fail, displaying the following error:
The seat(s) to be re-priced do not have the ?BUDSEATS ? Budweiser Bash Seats? extended seat definition which is required for buyer type ?BUDBASH ? Budweiser Bash Fridays?.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Venue should have some seats assigned with extended seat definition, note the details
2. Create a buyer type and map it to above said extended seat definition
3. Create a Price structure including the above buyer type
2. A ticket is sold using an ESD-Restricted buyer type (BUDBASH) to a seat with the required ESD.
The ESD is later removed from the seat.
3. Another user performs a re-offer on the seat and attempts to re-price the seat to another unrestricted buyer type (ADULT).  The re-price is successful.  Before checking out, the user realizes this was done in error and attempts to re-price again back to the original ESD-restricted buyer type.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. 
2. User should be able to complete the step successfully
3. The validation shall find that the seat does not have the required ESD and the re-price will fail, displaying the following error:
The seat(s) to be re-priced do not have the ?BUDSEATS ? Budweiser Bash Seats? extended seat definition which is required for buyer type ?BUDBASH ? Budweiser Bash Fridays?.

title: Verify that when complementary or upsell offers are configured and applicable, that the second offer also honors the ESD filter_Provenue online

title: Verify the lassoing of ESD seats and Non ESD seats in ISM
custom_steps:
1. 1.In the venue used for event, few seats should be mapped to extended seat definition ex:E1.(/*Apply ESD in such a way that The first 10 seats in each 20 seat row have the required ESD applied.  Therefore the last 10 seats in each row are dimmed.*/)
2.Create a buyer type
3.Map the   buyer type  to E1.
2. 4.Create a price structure using this buyer type
5.Create an event with this price structure
6.Perf Accept the event
3. Launch the pvo Link
Expected Result:
User must able to launch the link successfully
4. Click on view seat map
Expected Result:
User should successfully navigate to ISM
5. Request seats for an ESD-restricted buyer type.
Expected Result:
User must able to request seats for an ESD-restricted buyer type.  
ie The first 10 seats in each 20 seat row have the required ESD applied.  Therefore the last 10 seats in each row are dimmed.
6. Select 15 seats
Expected Result:
The user lassos 15 seats in a single row.
7. Filter the seats in the interactive seat map using an ESD-restricted buyer type.
Expected Result:
User must able to filter the seats in the interactive seat map using an ESD-restricted buyer type.
8. Verfiy the minicart
Expected Result:
In the mini-cart, the user will see that only the first 10 seats have the selected (ESD-restricted) buyer type associated.  The remaining 5 seats have no buyer type associated
9. Assign a buyer type to the 5 seats in the mini-cart /* Assign eligible buyer type*/
Expected Result:
User able to assign only eligible buyer types

The mini-chart will not allow an ESD-restricted buyer type to be assigned to a seat which does not have the extended seat definition applied

6. The user lassos 15 seats in a single row.
7. User must able to filter the seats in the interactive seat map using an ESD-restricted buyer type.
8. In the mini-cart, the user will see that only the first 10 seats have the selected (ESD-restricted) buyer type associated.  The remaining 5 seats have no buyer type associated

The mini-chart will not allow an ESD-restricted buyer type to be assigned to a seat which does not have the extended seat definition applied

title: Verify user is able to take the copy of an extended seat configuration

2. Select an event from the search result grid.
Expected Result:
System should display the Event Administration portal of the selected event
3. Select an Extended Seat Configuration from the text field.
Expected Result:
Selection should be highlighted.
4. Verify Extended Seat Definitions will be part of 
defining an Event Ticket Quota.  As such, the 
ability to copy an extended seat configuration and 
make minor adjustments is highly desired to 
simplify the process of managing event quotas.
Expected Result:
A new action for copying an existing extended 
seat configuration shall be added to the Venue 
Admin portal, similar to copying a price scale 
configuration.
5. Call

3. Select an Extended Seat Configuration from the text field.

defining an Event Ticket Quota.  As such, the 
ability to copy an extended seat configuration and 
make minor adjustments is highly desired to 
simplify the process of managing event quotas.
5. Call

Admin portal, similar to copying a price scale 
configuration.
5.

title: Verify whether proper error message is displayed if the user has a stale availability page and then does a lock request after the limit is hit with only one buyer type associated to the event
custom_steps:
1. 1. Navigate to supplier admin portal
2. Select the supplier
3. Navigate to price structure tab
4. Click new and Create a price structure with one buyer types and with two or more 
price scales
Expected Result:
Price structure with one buyer types and with 
two or more price scales should be created
2. Create an event with that price structure
Expected Result:
Event should be created with the price structure created in step 1
3. Navigate to capacity control tab and set capacity for the buyer type
Expected Result:
Capacity limit should be set
4. 1. Open 2 browsers simulatneously and load ticket sales 
2. Select same buyer type and set the # of tickets so that limit is hit in both the 
browers
5. Complete sale in one browser
Expected Result:
Sale should be completed successfully
6. 1. Now lock seats in the other browser
2. Verify whether proper error message is displayed if the user has a stale availability page and then does a lock 
request after the limit is hit with only one buyer type associated to the event
Expected Result:
Proper error message should be displayed 
* No valid price scale for this request could be 
determined.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Navigate to supplier admin portal
2. Select the supplier
3. Navigate to price structure tab
4. Click new and Create a price structure with one buyer types and with two or more 
price scales
2. Create an event with that price structure
3. Navigate to capacity control tab and set capacity for the buyer type
4. 1. Open 2 browsers simulatneously and load ticket sales 
2. Select same buyer type and set the # of tickets so that limit is hit in both the 
browers
5. Complete sale in one browser
6. 1. Now lock seats in the other browser
2. Verify whether proper error message is displayed if the user has a stale availability page and then does a lock 
request after the limit is hit with only one buyer type associated to the event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Price structure with one buyer types and with 
two or more price scales should be created
2. Event should be created with the price structure created in step 1
3. Capacity limit should be set
4. 
5. Sale should be completed successfully
6. Proper error message should be displayed 
* No valid price scale for this request could be 
determined.

title: Verify whether proper error message is displayed if the user has a stale availability page and then does a lock request after the limit is hit with more than one buyer type associated to the event
custom_steps:
1. 1. Navigate to supplier admin portal
2. Select the supplier
3. Navigate to price structure tab
4. Click new and Create a price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales
Expected Result:
Price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales should be created
2. Create an event with that price structure
Expected Result:
Event should be created with the price structure created in step 1
3. Navigate to capacity control tab and set capacity for one buyer type(for instance: 
CHILD)
Expected Result:
Capacity limit should be set
4. 1. Open 2 browsers simulatneously and load ticket sales 
2. Select same buyer type for which capacity limit has been set and set the # of tickets so that limit is hit in both the 
browers
5. 5. Complete sale in one browser
Expected Result:
Sale should be completed successfully
6. 1. Now lock seats in the other browser
2. Verify whether proper error message is displayed if the user has a stale availability page and then does a lock 
request after the limit is hit with more than one buyer type associated to th event
Expected Result:
Proper error message should be displayed 
for instance:
* The system is unable to price this request for buyer type CHILD-Child.

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Navigate to supplier admin portal
2. Select the supplier
3. Navigate to price structure tab
4. Click new and Create a price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales
2. Create an event with that price structure
3. Navigate to capacity control tab and set capacity for one buyer type(for instance: 
CHILD)
4. 1. Open 2 browsers simulatneously and load ticket sales 
2. Select same buyer type for which capacity limit has been set and set the # of tickets so that limit is hit in both the 
browers
5. 5. Complete sale in one browser
6. 1. Now lock seats in the other browser
2. Verify whether proper error message is displayed if the user has a stale availability page and then does a lock 
request after the limit is hit with more than one buyer type associated to th event
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales should be created
2. Event should be created with the price structure created in step 1
3. Capacity limit should be set
4. 
5. Sale should be completed successfully
6. Proper error message should be displayed 
for instance:
* The system is unable to price this request for buyer type CHILD-Child.

title: Verify that the buyer type is no longer available in the best available page if the capacity limit of the buyer type is hit
custom_steps:
1. 1. Navigate to supplier admin portal
2. Select the supplier
3. Navigate to price structure tab
4. Click new and Create a price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales
Expected Result:
Price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales should be created
2. Create an event with that price structure
Expected Result:
Event should be created with the price structure created in step 1
3. Navigate to capacity control tab and set capacity for one buyer type(Buyer 1)
Expected Result:
Capacity limit should be set
4. 1. Navigate to ticket sales
2. Select the event created in step 2
3. Select buyer 1 and select number of seats equal to the capacity limit for buyer 1
4.Complete a sale
Expected Result:
User should be able to complete the transaction 
successfully
5. Verify whether qty sold is updated and limit has reached
Expected Result:
Qty sold should be equal to the capacity limit
6. 1. Again navigate to ticket sales and select the same event
2. Verify whether Buyer 1 is  no longer available in the best availability page
Expected Result:
Buyer 1 should not be displayed in the 'available buyer type' window in Seat Command tab and 'buyer type' drop down 
in Selection Guide tab of best available page
7. 1. Remove one buyer type from the price structure 
2. Repeat steps 5 and 6
Expected Result:
buyer types and price scales should not be displayed in the best available page

custom_steps_separated.content:
1. 1. Navigate to supplier admin portal
2. Select the supplier
3. Navigate to price structure tab
4. Click new and Create a price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales
2. Create an event with that price structure
3. Navigate to capacity control tab and set capacity for one buyer type(Buyer 1)
4. 1. Navigate to ticket sales
2. Select the event created in step 2
3. Select buyer 1 and select number of seats equal to the capacity limit for buyer 1
4.Complete a sale
5. Verify whether qty sold is updated and limit has reached
6. 1. Again navigate to ticket sales and select the same event
2. Verify whether Buyer 1 is  no longer available in the best availability page
7. 1. Remove one buyer type from the price structure 
2. Repeat steps 5 and 6
custom_steps_separated.expected:
1. Price structure with two buyer types and with two or more price scales should be created
2. Event should be created with the price structure created in step 1
3. Capacity limit should be set
4. User should be able to complete the transaction 
successfully
5. Qty sold should be equal to the capacity limit
6. Buyer 1 should not be displayed in the 'available buyer type' window in Seat Command tab and 'buyer type' drop down 
in Selection Guide tab of best available page
7. buyer types and price scales should not be displayed in the best available page
